commit_message:
sync to latest oslo-incubator code

This patch also syncs with latest oslo-incubator, to solve bug
1354470 and safe log auth token when --debug is enabled, see
https://github.com/openstack/oslo-incubator/blob/master/openstack/common/apiclient/client.py#L128

Note, this patch also removes importutils.py since it is no longer used.

Change-Id: I4f2d18ef05c3be27cf2ee3474761408e3f5ccbcd
Closes-Bug: #1354470

commit_message:
libvirt: Add balloon period only if it is not None

This is a small check to verify that we add the stats period for the
Memory Balloon only if that value is not None. Adding that stats with
None as value will generate an invalid config.

Change-Id: I31ac7bd45597aae1d837667812e0cc1c876bd528
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/64/142864/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_config_memory_balloon_no_period(self): balloon = config.LibvirtConfigMemoryBalloon() balloon.model = 'fake_virtio' xml = balloon.to_xml() expected_xml = """ <memballoon model='fake_virtio' />""" self.assertXmlEqual(expected_xml, xml)

commit_message:
Deletes floating agent gw port on disassociate

This patch deletes the floating agent gw port
on floatingip disassociate.

A recent change in the neutron trunk broke
this functionality. This was introduced by
the patch that addressed the re-order
operations in (l3_dvr) update floating ip.

The current patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I98e766cf4ed33412d9d5dae07217553acbb5009c
Closes-Bug: #1394026
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/137247/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _update_fip_assoc(self, context, fip, floatingip_db, external_port): """Override to delete the fip agent gw port on disassociate.""" unused_agent_port = fip.get('port_id') if unused_agent_port is None and floatingip_db['fixed_port_id']: admin_ctx, floatingip_db, fip['id']) super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, self)._update_fip_assoc( context, fip, floatingip_db, external_port)
deleted_lines: def update_floatingip(self, context, id, floatingip): res_fip = super(L3_NAT_with_dvr_db_mixin, self).update_floatingip( context, id, floatingip) fip = floatingip['floatingip'] unused_agent_port = (fip.get('port_id', -1) is None and res_fip.get('fixed_port_id')) if unused_agent_port: admin_ctx, floatingip, fip['id']) return res_fip

commit_message:
Remove unused images from fuel-docs

This commit removes images that are in the repository though
not referenced by any documents.

The steps followed to build this list are as follows:
Get list of images in repo:
find fuel-docs/_images/ -type f|awk -F "/" \
{'print $NF'}|sort|uniq>repo-images.txt

Find referenced images in RSTs:
egrep -r ".png|.jpg|.svg" `find fuel-docs/pages \
-name \*rst -type f`|awk -F "/" {'print $NF'}| \
sort|uniq>used-images.txt

Get list of unused images:
comm -2 -3 repo-images.txt used-images.txt>unused-images.txt

Find list of images referenced with wildcard and exclude
those from the list of images to be removed:
grep -r "_images/" *|egrep "\*"

Check for images referenced in _templates and exclude
those as well:
egrep -r ".png|.jpg|.svg" _templates/*

Change-Id: Ic45394f144d141e29c5a9eb1c457cdb757d3bf08
Closes-Bug: 1406412
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/73/144373/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add cpu pinning check to numa_fit_instance_to_host

Fitting instance to host will now consider if instance requested cpu
pinning. We still don't set cpu_pinning to a non-None value so this path
will not be hit yet.

In addition we make both paths now mutate the passed cell instead of
creating a new object for consistency.

Change-Id: Ic0b5ffec4eba717a7b9f8dec165acba43205f72a
Blueprint: virt-driver-cpu-pinning
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/34/139134/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cpu_pinning_requested = all(numacell.cpu_pinning is not None for numacell in instance_topology.cells) if cpu_pinning_requested: got_cell = _numa_fit_instance_cell_with_pinning( host_cell, instance_cell) else: got_cell = _numa_fit_instance_cell( host_cell, instance_cell, limit_cell)

commit_message:
Define OpenStack projects without Programs

Adds a YAML file describing all of the projects that live in the
openstack/ code namespace. The description of projects is done according
to a set of fields that are documented and defined in a JSONSchema
document project-schema.json. The fields describing the projects
correspond to what I feel are useful for governance purposes, as well as
for end users and operators.

The impetus for this approach is described in this blog post:

http://www.joinfu.com/2014/09/so-what-is-the-core-of-openstack/

Note that the four release models that are used in the project
JSONSchema:

- coordinated-managed
- coordinated
- compatible
- rolling

Correspond to Thierry's excellent description of the various release
models from the comments on review #125786.

OK, discuss.

Change-Id: I31f04e24b17574165014f27df7a27d05bac19100

commit_message:
Reorganized scss imports

This patch moves all css style tags from html head and imports them properly
in horizon.scss. There will be only one request to make to bring all styleshets
as it will be compiled into single horizon.css file.

Imports have been reoganized to fit file structure, naming conventions
and to enable use of horizon variables.

Partially-Implements: blueprint css-breakdown
Closes-Bug: 1390104
Change-Id: I868289b010589f01339615390cf0b2f09b11eb1c

commit_message:
Catch PortNotFound and SubnetNotFound during network_delete

In some cases PortNotFound exception during network_delete
could be caused by concurrent port deletion by DHCP agent.
This condition should not prevent network from deleting.

Change-Id: Ie6eae4cecb64120c41de9823d9e72066094ad2ce
Closes-Bug: #1405197
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/98/143698/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exc.PortNotFound: # concurrent port deletion can be performed by # release_dhcp_port caused by concurrent subnet_delete LOG.info(_LI("Port %s was deleted concurrently"), port.id)

commit_message:
Python 3 fix mocking

mock.assert_has_calls() expect a list of mock.call(), instead of
only one object.
In Python 2 it works fine, but Python 3 doesn't. This patch fix
it passing [mock.call()] to assert_has_calls

Change-Id: I731046278a118f6b3218d8f3900c5d1b52d4f249

commit_message:
Fixing the problem in loading plugins

This patch fixes the problem in loading the plugins in devstack
by defining the "plugins" variable in "run_plugins" function of
devstack/functions-common file.

Change-Id: I9fb0e24bf1fd282931a8489e0a8ec0c9ea078520
Closes-Bug: 1408571

commit_message:
Add a fixture to let tests manage the lazy flag

We do not want to expose the stored lazy flag, but we do want to allow
applications to force it to a certain state and then restore it to its
original test for testing. This new fixture provides a way to do that.

Change-Id: Ica05fd8fc7e687da69d61ea84bf1ceae65db93ce

commit_message:
Allow the option of not starting openstack services

The functional test job of some openstack projects (e.g. neutron) uses devstack
to set up the environment for the functional tests. This currently involves
running devstack to get the service installed, and then running unstack because
the tests do not want the service actually running.

Thus it would be convenient if we had a way to tell devstack to stop after
installing the enabled services, and not actually start them.

We add a configuration option START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES which defaults to True
to preserve existing behavior. Setting this option to False will prevent
OpenStack services from starting.

Re-organize some config_, init_, and start_ functions to simplify the flow
where the option is checked. Also add a post-start phase for services, called
"commission_" where setting up of resources is done by some services.

Change-Id: I867ef1362543a28a9031df1df35f254b02e377bb
Closes-bug: #1405838
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/77/144177/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # To install OpenStack services but not start them, set this to False START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES=$(trueorfalse True $START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES) # OpenStack services have the following startup phases: # configure_$service = configure things for the service # init_$service = initialize things the service depends on # start_$service = start the process(es), maybe do some checks # commission_$service = create useful resources (volumes, networks, etc.) function configure_openstack_service { echo_summary "Configuring ${1^}" configure_$1 } function init_openstack_service { echo_summary "Initializing ${1^}" init_$1 } function start_openstack_service { if [[ "$START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES" == "True" ]]; then echo_summary "Starting ${1^}" start_$1 fi } function commission_openstack_service { if [[ "$START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES" == "True" ]]; then echo_summary "Creating ${1^} resources" commission_$1 fi } # Use screen only if we are going to start OpenStack services USE_SCREEN=$(trueorfalse $START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES $USE_SCREEN)start_openstack_service dstat echo_summary "Configuring Keystone" init_openstack_service keystone start_openstack_service keystone init_openstack_service horizon start_openstack_service horizon init_openstack_service glance configure_openstack_service neutron init_openstack_service neutron configure_openstack_service neutron_third_party init_openstack_service neutron_third_party start_openstack_service neutron_third_party init_openstack_service swift init_openstack_service cinder init_openstack_service nova init_openstack_service nova_cells start_openstack_service swift start_openstack_service glanceif is_service_enabled zeromq && [[ "$START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES" == "True" ]]; then start_openstack_service nova_api start_openstack_service neutron start_openstack_service nova_net start_openstack_service neutron_agentsif is_service_enabled q-svc; then commission_openstack_service neutron start_openstack_service nova start_openstack_service cinder commission_openstack_service cinder init_openstack_service ceilometer start_openstack_service ceilometer init_openstack_service heat start_openstack_service heat commission_openstack_service heatif is_service_enabled nova && is_service_enabled key && \ [[ "$START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES" == "True" ]]; thenif is_service_enabled horizon && [[ "$START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES" == "True" ]]; thenif is_service_enabled key && [[ "$START_OPENSTACK_SERVICES" == "True" ]]; then
deleted_lines: USE_SCREEN=$(trueorfalse True $USE_SCREEN)start_dstat echo_summary "Starting Keystone" init_keystone start_keystone echo_summary "Configuring and starting Horizon" init_horizon start_horizon echo_summary "Configuring Glance" init_glance echo_summary "Configuring Neutron" configure_neutron init_neutron configure_neutron_third_party init_neutron_third_party start_neutron_third_party echo_summary "Configuring Swift" init_swift echo_summary "Configuring Cinder" init_cinder echo_summary "Configuring Nova" init_nova init_nova_cells echo_summary "Starting Swift" start_swift echo_summary "Starting Glance" start_glanceif is_service_enabled zeromq; then echo_summary "Starting Nova API" start_nova_api echo_summary "Starting Neutron" start_neutron_service_and_check check_neutron_third_party_integration NM_CONF=${NOVA_CONF} if is_service_enabled n-cell; then NM_CONF=${NOVA_CELLS_CONF} fi # Create a small network $NOVA_BIN_DIR/nova-manage --config-file $NM_CONF network create "$PRIVATE_NETWORK_NAME" $FIXED_RANGE 1 $FIXED_NETWORK_SIZE $NETWORK_CREATE_ARGS # Create some floating ips $NOVA_BIN_DIR/nova-manage --config-file $NM_CONF floating create $FLOATING_RANGE --pool=$PUBLIC_NETWORK_NAME # Create a second pool $NOVA_BIN_DIR/nova-manage --config-file $NM_CONF floating create --ip_range=$TEST_FLOATING_RANGE --pool=$TEST_FLOATING_POOL start_neutron_agentsif is_service_enabled q-svc && [[ "$NEUTRON_CREATE_INITIAL_NETWORKS" == "True" ]]; then echo_summary "Creating initial neutron network elements" create_neutron_initial_network setup_neutron_debug echo_summary "Starting Nova" start_nova echo_summary "Starting Cinder" start_cinder create_volume_types echo_summary "Starting Ceilometer" init_ceilometer start_ceilometer # Initialize heat echo_summary "Configuring Heat" init_heat echo_summary "Starting Heat" start_heat if [ "$HEAT_CREATE_TEST_IMAGE" = "True" ]; then echo_summary "Building Heat functional test image" build_heat_functional_test_image fiif is_service_enabled nova && is_service_enabled key; thenif is_service_enabled horizon; thenif is_service_enabled key; then

commit_message:
Add a new custom matcher render_config_file to test ini file content

After this, you can use below way to test ini file content:
render_config_file(file).with_section_content(section, content)

Change-Id: Iaed80a3fc61db02324fb2c8166b7032fd1823f60
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-common refs/changes/15/140215/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # encoding: UTF-8 if defined?(ChefSpec) # # Test method for ini format file # # Example file content: # # [section1] # option1 = value1 # option2 = value2 # [section2] # option1 = value2 # # Example custom matcher that can be called in other # dependends cookbooks. # # render_config_file(path).with_section_content( # 'section1', 'option1 = value1') # render_config_file(path).with_section_content( # 'section1', /^option2 = value2$/) # def render_config_file(path) RenderConfigFileMatcher.new(path) end # # Extend the RenderFileMatcher as RenderConfigFileMatcher, # add a new method with_section_content for ini format file. # class RenderConfigFileMatcher < ChefSpec::Matchers::RenderFileMatcher def with_section_content(section, expected_content) @section = section @expected_content = expected_content self end # rubocop:disable MethodLength, CyclomaticComplexity def matches_content? def get_section_content(content, section) match = false section_content = '' content.split("\n").each do |line| if line =~ /^[ \t]*\[#{section}\]/ match = true next end if match == true && ! (line =~ /^[ \t]*\[/) section_content << "#{line}\n" end break if match == true && line =~ /^[ \t]*\[/ end section_content end return true if @expected_content.nil? @actual_content = ChefSpec::Renderer.new(@runner, resource).content unless @actual_content.nil? unless @section.nil? @actual_content = get_section_content(@actual_content, @section) end end return false if @actual_content.nil? if @expected_content.is_a?(Regexp) @actual_content =~ @expected_content elsif RSpec::Matchers.is_a_matcher?(@expected_content) @expected_content.matches?(@actual_content) else @actual_content.include?(@expected_content) end end # rubocop:enable MethodLength, CyclomaticComplexity end end

commit_message:
Fix some comments in a backporting review session

  * add i18n support to some exception messages
  * remove the return value of DecayingTimer.start()

Relates to review: I898a236a384b3466147026abc7a1ee21801e8ca1

Change-Id: I7adf5478732f1f46db1009b059b66ff8af6ecdc3

commit_message:
add bp:ssh-auth-strategy

Blueprint to support multiple ssh auth strategies.

Change-Id: Ib882fd2c9354b91c5069a35ec74003e0259fec3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/qa-specs refs/changes/41/94741/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. ====================================================== Support for multiple strategies for ssh access to VMs ====================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tempest/+spec/ssh-auth-strategy Different strategies for ssh access to VMs in tests. Problem description =================== Support for ssh access to VMs in tempest tests is both heterogeneous as well as incomplete. Heterogeneous because not all tests honour the same config options. The existing run_ssh option is only taken into account by some of the tests, notably not by the most recent Neutron tests. Incomplete because ssh access is only available to a very limited number of cloud configuration: - access to the "fixed" IP address is only available with nova networking, and in case of single server deployment (e.g. tempest running against devstack single-node cloud) - authentication via password is only available if the hypervisor supports password injection (e.g. XEN, but not libvirt) - firewall rules won't block ssh traffic to the VM only as long as nova or neutron are configured with allow-all by default It's also incomplete because the ssh verification utility do not provide enough granularity and debugging option to troubleshoot issues wish ssh to VMs. Proposed change =============== Two new configuration flags are introduced, that allow defining the connection method and the authentication strategy. Extract from the generated tempest.conf.sample: :: # Auth method used for authenticate to the instance. Valid # choices are: keypair, configured, adminpass. keypair: start # the servers with an ssh keypair. configured: use the # configured user and password. adminpass: use the injected # adminPass. disabled: avoid using ssh when it is an option. # (string value) #ssh_auth_method=keypair # How to connect to the instance? fixed: using the first ip # belongs the fixed network floating: creating and using a # floating ip (string value) #ssh_connect_method=fixed .. TBD Alternatives ------------ TBD Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Attila Fazekas <afazekas@redhat.com> Other assignees: Nithya Ganesan <nithya.ganesan@hp.com> Andrea Frittoli <andrea.frittoli@hp.com> Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Juno-1 Work Items ---------- - TBD Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
[WIP] Add Logstash filters for Swift logging

Capture Swift logs from Syslog, tag and extract transaction IDs, and
break out messages by format, service, and resource types.

Adds Swift filters to logstash configuration set.

Change-Id: I510c7826b269925a65a53b4a24eeb4f8b8904e0f
Closes-Bug: #1399371
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/64/141164/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #----------------------------------------------------------------------- # Parse & tag generic syslog logs, including swift logs # i.e.: # 1) Nov 10 23:18:55 nosthame proxy-server: User: test uses token AUTH_tkc9512a6c98bb4ccf84e17e453347ebf8 (trans_id tx7872ea1e11eb48d989735-00546147df) grok { match => { "message" => "%{SYSLOGTIMESTAMP:syslog_timestamp} %{SYSLOGHOST:syslog_hostname} %{DATA:syslog_program}(?:\[%{POSINT:syslog_pid}\])?: %{GREEDYDATA:syslog_message}" } break_on_match => false add_tag => [ "syslog-generic" ] remove_tag => [ "_grokparsefailure" ] }

commit_message:
cinder-rtstool: should use acl.node_wwn

In newer version of rtslib module, NodeACL is now an object, not a
dict. Thus, acl.node_wwn must be used instead of acl['node_wwn'],
otherwise it will fail with exception.

Change-Id: I0fb53596a2a99609aa4d573f1254b3afa7d9fd91
Closes-Bug: #1408443

commit_message:
Update oslo.config to 1.6.0

oslo.config 1.6.0 was released and includes the change to move the
modules out of the namespace package. Before updating the projects
to use this the requirements needs to be updated.

Change-Id: I0e907cc6feac66663b3933fccd61b72b3fe10214

commit_message:
Fixed display issues on Details Page caused by bootstrap 3 update

Per UX suggestion applied Bootstrap 'dl-horizontal' styling plus
added css to left justify the labels on the details page.  Also
addeds col-sm-12 div inside all row divs in detail views, to achieve
proper bootstrap grid usage.

Closes-bug: #1349602
Change-Id: I337150c7a8c90cc838fac8cb89a552a0566789e3

There's no longer any reason to do this with the target drivers,

commit_message:
Use cinder.utils.execute directly

When we were in the process of working on brick libs
we did quite a bit of funky stuff with setting a member
variable for each class to point to an executor that was
passed in during init.

There's no longer any reason to do this with the target drivers,
so we should simplify our lives a bit and go back to using the
good old cinder.utils wrapper.

It's also believed that the use of the member variable is
susceptible to some concurrency issue that was causing the
wrong cmd string to be executed.  We'll mark this as closing
that bug and reopen if we still see the signature in Kibana.

Change-Id: I7a5648d496d15eec5d7ac3643411198226f1ffdf
Closes-Bug: #1398078

added_lines: from cinder import utils (out, _err) = utils.execute('iscsiadm', '-m', 'discovery',
